Title: Operations Coordinator - Remote Broadcast Centers (12 Month Contract)
RoleDescription:
The Operational Assistant is a key support role within Riot Games, responsible for providing administrative, systems, and operational coordination for the Remote Broadcast Centers (RBC). Working closely with the Global Operations Director and key stakeholders across Production, Enterprise, and Content Services, this role ensures the smooth execution of project tracking, business processes, reporting workflows, and day-to-day operational support at the RBC.
The role is vital to maintaining comprehensive production documentation, workflows and delivery structures, monthly operational reporting, supporting budgeting and reconciliation efforts, and ensuring seamless rituals and communication between RBC and CS departments. The Operational Assistant will provide support on coordination between Riot Enterprise teams on financial or legal workflows and approvals, alongside supporting the rollout of internal processes, acting as a key liaison between Riot Games RBC leadership and operational teams.
This position is best suited for an organized, detail-oriented individual with strong administrative, reconciliation and coordination skills. The ideal candidate will have experience in business operations, financial processing, and stakeholder management, with the ability to multitask in a fast-paced production environment.
Please note this is a 12 month contract role and will be based within the Dublin Remote Broadcast Center in Swords. 
Key Responsibilities

Support the Global Operations Director in Daily Operations across both RBCs (Dublin and Seattle): Assist with the coordination of key operational activities, ensuring smooth execution of workflows
Provide administrative, systems, and operational coordination for the Remote Broadcast Centers (RBC)
Coordinate meetings, document agendas, and track follow-ups for RBC operational discussions.
Support project tracking, business processes, reporting workflows, and day-to-day operational tasks at the RBC
Maintain comprehensive production documentation, workflows, and delivery structures
Prepare and manage monthly operational reporting,  including utilisation tracking and project management.
Facilitate rituals and communication between RBC and Content Services (CS) departments
Coordinate with Riot Enterprise teams on financial and legal workflows and approvals
Support the rollout of internal processes
Act as a key liaison between RBC leadership and operational teams
Manage stakeholder communication and coordination
Ensure accuracy and timeliness in financial processing and reconciliation -  including purchase orders (coupa), legal signatory workflows, invoice tracking, budget reconciliation, and event expense management.
Support budgeting and reconciliation efforts
Assist in multitasking and coordination within a fast-paced production environment

Essential Experience & Skills

Experience in business operations, financial processing, or administrative coordination.
Proficient Project Management skills
Strong attention to detail, with the ability to track and manage financial transactions.
Excellent organizational and multitasking skills in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to work with cross-functional teams and support various operational workflows.
Proficiency in financial tracking tools and business operations software.
Strong communication and problem-solving skills.

Desirable Experience & Skills

Previous experience in a media, broadcast, or production environment.
Familiarity with financial systems and reporting tools such as Coupa, Ironclad and Airtable.
Understanding of contract management and vendor coordination.
Experience working in an international or multi-site business environment.

Title: Principal Animation Artist - Unpublished R&D Product
RoleDescription:
As a member of the Animation team, you bring characters to life through classic animation principles and body mechanics. You will create high quality animations for a diverse and rapidly growing universe, including bipeds, quadrupeds, and creatures.  A great reel will showcase a variety of walk cycles, combat animations, and a strong foundation in the principles of animation, including weight, anticipation, and impact.  Also working to expand our current content pipeline, you will collaborate with designers and artists to develop new features and technologies. Your craft expertise will breathe life into iconic and beloved characters for players.
As a Principal Animation Artist on the Research & Development (R&D) team, you will be responsible for animations that meet specific gameplay design requirements. The team is small and the role requires a high level of AAA game development experience that is focused on output of a wide variety of animation content. You are required to work independently with designers and make decisions that are inline with the animation style with a good balance between readability and quality. As the game moves into production, the role shifts towards traditional animation content creation. 
Responsibilities:

Create animation assets at production level quality
Work closely with design and create animations that meet the specific gameplay requirements 
Anticipate and recognize potential conflicts or production issues and provide recommended solutions 
Recognize areas of opportunity for animation to enhance gameplay and create animation artifacts to establish and articulate the projects animation style
Meet project deadlines in a timely manner without compromising artistic integrity 
Generate prototype VFX that communicates gameplay mechanics  
Serve as the main point of contact for the projects animation team by consistently communicate with the team by giving and receiving feedback, directing next steps, and providing clear goals and outcomes to your team
Establish best practices and lead initiatives related to animation
Motivate and develop the team members and act as a mentor in terms of technical/artistic aspects
Direct and provide detailed feedback to external animation developers to assist in an outsourcing pipeline

Required Qualifications:

8+ years of professional experience working in animation within the gaming industry
5+ years of professional experience working in Maya
3+ years of experience working directly in Unreal Engine with experience implementing characters

Desired Qualifications:

Strong sense of game design and gameplay
Character combat animation experience 
PC and mobile game development experience
Experience collaborating and providing feedback to external vendors 
Strong pre-vis and storytelling animation skills 

As a part of the application process, you will be expected to provide a portfolio or demo reel of their work and may be asked to complete an art test.

Title: Senior Technical Product Manager - League Studios, League Data Central
RoleDescription:
As a Product Manager, youll lead passionate cross-functional teams to create innovative internal and external tools that unlock Riots ability to deliver player value. By leading engineers, youll drive development, smash through obstacles, and push projects across the finish-line. Youll meet and exceed expectations by helping concept, deliver, enhance, and influence projects at every stage of production. Youll do all of this in service of an ambitious transformation of Riots company infrastructure into a highly adaptable, efficient and effective machine that multiplies Riots ability to deliver player value.
League Data Central (LDC) is a team within League Studios accountable for decision science, data products, data capture, and data warehousing and governance for League Studio. Our mission is to harness the power of data for player-centric decisions and AI/ML products that make it better to be a player.
As the Senior Technical Product Manager for LDC, you will partner with game teams on executing data initiatives, focusing primarily on Teamfight Tactics (TFT) and Fight for the Golden Spatula (FFGS). Your expertise in data and product will inform the advancement of data capabilities, guiding decision-making and fostering product innovation in partnership with the TFT and FFGS game teams. You will report to the Director, Technical Product Management of LDC.
Responsibilities:

Develop and manage the product roadmap for TFT and FFGS data products, aligning with game team needs and LDC's overall strategy
Define data requirements for new TFT and FFGS features, ensuring data availability and quality
Collaborate with Engineering (data engineers, software engineers, and machine learning engineers), Data Science (data scientists), and Production (product and delivery/program management) on LDC to align the product and technical plans
Partner with the TFT and FFGS game teams to understand their data needs and translate them into actionable product requirements
Validate requirements and designs for data-intensive projects, communicating technical tradeoffs to a non-technical audience
Develop an understanding of and empathy for our development and data consumer customers, which you'll use to make player-focused decisions
Build relationships with partner teams across Riot Games, particularly within the TFT and FFGS teams
Analyze player data and identify opportunities to improve the player experience in TFT and FFGS
Define and align OKRs, and KPIs with key partners, setting clear expectations for quantifiable impact and accountability. Secure buy-in from stakeholders through influence and partnership

Required Qualifications:

A minimum of 6 years of relevant data product experience
A solid foundation in AI/ML, data analysis, experimental design, and their application in product development, supported by a technical bachelors or masters degree (or equivalent experience)
Excellent teamwork, communication, and stakeholder management skills
Understanding of player/customer needs within complex audience segments and the ability to discern needs from wants
Ability to clearly communicate complex topics to audiences with little-to-no context, conveying nuances effectively
Experience leading and delivering successful analytics, data science, and machine learning projects
Ability to understand and validate technical requirements and designs in the context of data projects

Desired Qualifications:

Experience collaborating with platform and infrastructure teams
A history of partnering with creative stakeholders and technical teams in gaming, media, or similar fields.
Experience with Teamfight Tactics (TFT) and/or Fight for the Golden Spatula (FFGS).

Title: Senior Service Designer, Player Support (Contract)
RoleDescription:
Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. In 2009, Riot released its debut title League of Legends to critical and player acclaim. As the most played PC game in the world, over 100 million play every month. Players form the foundation of our community and its for them that we continue to evolve and improve the League of Legends experience.Were looking for humble but ambitious, razor-sharp professionals who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take play seriously; youre passionate about games. We embrace those who see things differently, arent afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints.Thats where you come in.
As a Senior Service Designer - Player Support professional, youll be a key player in our Service Transformation team, tackling complex challenges to deliver a seamless player experience.  Youll design solutions that enable Riots Player Support to consistently exceed player expectations across all touchpoints with our player-support product, UX, policies, and operations.
The Service Transformation team is on a mission to uncover transformative insights and opportunities to champion unforgettable service experiences that leave players deeply satisfied. We are the incubators of service design and experience for Riots strategic priorities.
In this global role, you will:

Collaborate closely with the Head of Service Transformation, Player Support (PS) leadership, and cross-functional teams across regions to identify and prioritize service design and improvement opportunities.
Lead the design and implementation of service blueprints that map the entire player support journey, ensuring a seamless and positive experience across all touchpoints.
Manage a project portfolio focused on service design and improvement initiatives, leveraging data insights to guide the process from concept to execution.
Advocate for and integrate player/community feedback and experience metrics into service design decisions, ensuring continuous improvement in client/service usability, satisfaction, and loyalty.
Partner with data analysts to translate CSat / SaSI markers into actionable insights for operational improvements.
Proactively identify potential issues and events that could impact the player experience, working with teams to develop preventative measures and refine policies and processes.
Design and implement impactful player support policies.
Collaborate with PS leadership and cross-functional teams to develop and execute end-to-end service design strategies across all games and markets.
Inform, consult, and contribute to the development and execution of player retention strategies.
Confidently present your work, proposals, and research findings to senior stakeholders, effectively communicating your ideas and recommendations.

Required Qualifications:

8+ years of experience in a fast-paced, project-based environment with a proven track record of service design and service experience delivery.
5+ years of direct experience within customer service operations, customer experience design, or UX design.
Demonstrated experience in owning and leading CX, UX & service improvement projects through the entire lifecycle.
Proficiency in a variety of management tools, including Google Suite (or MS Office), Miro and/or Jira, Scrum, and Kanban methodologies.
A passion for ensuring exceptional player experiences and a strong desire to deliver results.
Excellent written, verbal, and visual communication skills with the ability to negotiate and resolve conflicts effectively.
A highly proactive and results-oriented individual with a strong sense of ownership and the ability to work with minimal supervision.
A proven ability to lead and influence teams to deliver high-quality work.
Exceptional time management, resource management, prioritization, and problem-solving skills.
The ability to effectively analyze data to understand operational performance.
Willingness and capacity to travel up to 20%.
A strong technical curiosity and a commitment to continuous learning in technology, tools, and methodologies.
A Bachelors degree (BA/BS) or equivalent practical experience.

Experience designing and improving work systems for both individual and multiple teams.
Previous experience working within a Customer Service Operations environment.
A history of success in a product support or customer support management role.

Title: Manager, Competitive Operations
RoleDescription:
As League Operations Manager for Americas Esports you will report to the Head of Competitive Operations, Americas and be part of the Competitive Operations Department in Los Angeles. You will lead a lean but impactful team of esports professionals to govern and operate VALORANT, League of Legends, and Team Fight Tactics (TFT) esports in Americas.Your focus will be the administration and operation of VALORANT, League of Legends, and TFT esport esports in the Americas. The Americas Esports ecosystem spans across North America, LATAM and Brazil. In collaboration with your colleagues, your goal is to operate a competition ecosystem that offers best-in-class sports media entertainment for fans, an aspirational career opportunity for pro players, a healthy business environment for teams and partners, and a competition that meets the highest standards of competitive integrity.
Responsibilities:

Lead a team of league operators to manage day to day competitive operations of our Americas esports properties in the territory
Manage and/or coach team members, provide guidance in day to day work
Work closely with the Department Head and Product Lead(s) to continue developing a competitive ecosystem that lasts for generations
Maintain and evolve the competition rules and policies to match the ever-changing needs of the ecosystem
Be a point of contact for pro team management to handle day to day competitive operations
Develop robust processes with vendors and contractors to meet our high standards for integrity and operational excellence
Be in close sync with competition managers for other Riot Games esports titles to create synergetic processes and consistency across the ecosystem

Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused game development can result in great games. We believe that illuminating the globally diverse experiences, behaviors, and needs of players is critical to Riot living up to our player-focused mission. We're a group united by our love of games, science, and helping others succeed.

Conduct global qualitative research and provide actionable guidance for the games team in terms of trends, emerging risks, and opportunities

Experience conducting market research or collaborating with market research vendors
Experience in product design or business strategy for consumer-facing products

Title: Financial Accountant - 4 Month Contract
RoleDescription:
As Financial Accountant (EMEA) in the Riot Games Dublin office you will support senior leadership in Europe by managing reporting, compliance and processes. You will handle preparation of statutory statements and assist with annual fiscal audits in an EMEA environment with a broad awareness of financial and legal implications. You will report to the Accounting Manager. Your rock-solid judgment and integrity will help you keep everyone on the right track while you work to set up and maintain best-in-class processes and systems.
This is a 4 month contract role that will cover paternity leave within our Dublin office, it will be based on site in our Dublin team. 
Responsibilities 

Participate in all activities related to full-cycle accounting, including building journal entries, reconciling general ledger accounts, preparing monthly reporting packages, answering questions from the central accounting team and researching and resolving discrepancies.
Drive the entire year-end financial process including coordination with the external audit team, tax advisors and sign-off on the local financial statements across all jurisdictions
Responsible for a number of Riot subsidiary companies and their compliance. This will require cross collaboration across various teams such as Talent, Legal, Treasury and others
Research unusual transactions and follow up with other groups to get more information. Discuss the findings with the accounting team to conclude on the proper accounting treatment.
Maintain a tight monthly reporting schedule according to established time-frames
Investigate fluctuations and monitor trends in the accounts. Work with other teams to gain a deep understanding of the story behind the movements.
Speak for the numbers, answering finance-related questions through exploratory data analyses and ad-hoc reporting
This role requires a high attention to detail and the ability to analyze financial data to identify trends and inform business decisions
You have clear and fact driven communication skills and know how to keep stakeholders informed and working towards your end goals.

Required Qualifications 

You have bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or related field
Professional accounting certification such as Associate Chartered Accountant (ACA) or equivalent
You can create reports and analyses using Excel and associated accounting software like Oracle
Big 4 or mid-tier trained in assurance 
1 to 2 years post qualified experience in industry would be a bonus
It would be a bonus if you have experienced the year-end financial process including coordination with the external audit team, tax advisors and sign-off on the local financial statements across all jurisdictions
Experience in payroll would also be a bonus
